text:
This beer won me on the Pour. Clear amber with a red tint. The aroma is great. Malty with wood. The flavor has caramel and vanilla. Nice lasting after taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. This one is really nice, the rye is apparaent, very creamy and rich mouthfeel, herbal, good malt character, smooth. Good one.
From a bomber shared at home. Pours a clear pale mahogany with an ecru head. Aroma of caramel and toffee. Flavors same with some vanilla and oak. Sweet and tasty,
On tap at World of Beer (Charlottesville, VA). Aromas of cinnamon, vanilla, whiskey, spice, rum. Clear bronze with a fading white head. Full bodied.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 9/7/2016. Pours crystal clear medium ruby red/copper color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big caramel, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, vanilla, spicy rye, whiskey, toasted oak, biscuit, and nuttiness; with lighter notes of coconut, roast, raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/bready/rye malt, rye whiskey barrel, and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big caramel, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, vanilla, spicy rye, whiskey, toasted oak, biscuit, and nuttiness; with lighter notes of coconut, roast, raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, herbal, grass, light pepper, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/peppery hop and rye/whiskey/oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of caramel, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, vanilla, spicy rye, whiskey, toasted oak, biscuit, nuttiness, herbal, grass, pepper, and yeast/oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/rye malt, rye whiskey barrel, and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance, and zero astringent hop/rye/barrel flavors after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitter/spiciness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready, and fairly sticky/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is fairly well hidden; a pleasant warmth with minimal barrel booziness lingering after the finish. Overall this is a great barrel aged imperial ESB style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/rye malt, rye whiskey barrel, and light-moderate fruity yeast/earthy hop flavors; very smooth and easy to sip on for the big ABV. Feels more hoppy, tannic, and barrel influenced than last years similar style; but was just as impressive. A very enjoyable offering.

Bottle. Big, deeply brown and wholly frothy ... This has a rich, malty aroma, and drinks like the biggest, meatiest, most muscular brown ale ever. I typically dont love English brown ales, and although this is labeled an ESB, Id put it more in the brown category ... the rye aspect must make it grittier. But this is a delicious and fully flavored brew, and a nice alternative to the onslaught of uber-hoppy, citrusy beers attacking our society. This is a giant brew and huge alcohol kicker, but it resonates with a classical style that makes it all better. (#6557, 3/29/2017)

Bomber from nimbleprop. Dark amber and semi opaque. This is huge malts and I am not sure how it is an ESB. Super sweet malts dominate this. Occasionally some dark fruit pops in and some alcohol. Just a little rye whiskey. This is kind of a BBW of beers. Big and sweet.

Thin light orange head of fine bubbles. Dissipates rather quickly. Sweet caramel in the aroma with some butterscotch, vanilla, bourbon and lots of malts. Aroma reminiscent of a barley wine and not an ESB. Color is a ruddy orangish brown. Moderate malt body and backbone which leaves it a bit on the sweet side. Buttery toffee, dark fruit, light herbal hops and some dry roasted grains which impart a bit of chalkiness to the palate. Moderate alcohol presence. Finishes sweet yet on the dry side. A pretty good brew.$

22oz bottle pours a clear, garnet amber with a ring of white head. Nose has dried apple slices, booze, some candlewax, a little brandy/cognac, caramel, malt. Flavor follows, sweet malt and caramel, booze, bourbon, brandy, cognac, apples and pears, some bubblegum, some marzipan. Full bodied, boozy finish. A little messy. Might do well with a few months on it.

Tap. Poured clear dark brown color with medium off-white frothy head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Medium to heavy toasted dark malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted malt sweet flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a solid brew.

Rich super hazy brown, copper, bronze and muddy ruby tinted body with a small single cetimetre tall tan head. Aroma of super pungent toasted malt and metal with fruits, earth, grain, yeast and smelling of a lot of alcohol. Full-bodied; Rich toasted malt flavours with a pungent grain and toffee flavour, coupled with a lot of medicinal and metallic flavours and ending with a nice warming alcohol sensation. Aftertaste is quite complex with flavours ranging from cereal to pit fruits, toffee, earth, apricots, caramel, oak and vanilla all with the big malt and sweet flavours, without too much bitterness. Overall, a nice beer that shows a stiff pungency at first, but after a few seconds, those will dissipate and leave a nice and rich palate in place for minutes to come. I sampled this ten ounce draught at Whole Foods in Pentagon City (Arlington), Virginia on 03-February-2017 for US$4,00 at the end of my driveway!

22oz bottle. Small beige head atop crystal clear garnet body. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel/brown sugar, some rye/spicy, light orange. Taste is sweet, orange, caramel, some rye/alcohol. Sticky medium-full body, low carbonation. Once upon a time there were nip bottles, and this beer would be better suited for one of those than this bomber.

$8.79 bomber from Wine Warehouse. Pours brown with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel, wet dog, whiskey, spice. Flavor is caramel malt, alcohol, toffee, earth - really dirty near the end, spice, and vanilla. Meh.

Bomber from Beer Run. Clear dark ruby red, thin fizzy tan head, fair retention. Aroma of whiskey, oak, rye, strawberry, toasted malt. The taste is strawberry, vanilla, whiskey, oak, toffee, rye. Medium bodied, hints of booze.

Draft to snifter at Dutchs. Pours a clear deep amber color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have some booze early, sweet malts, caramel, toffee, definitely get the Marris Otter, light nutty, some fruity character, a hint of spicy rye like character, wood, rye whiskey, ok.

Bomber into tulip glass, clear reddish-copper color with light tan head. Aroma notes of wood, brown sugar, malt fruitiness, grain, nuttiness and light whiskey. Taste adds more oakiness, black tea, bready, toffee and earthy bitterness. Heavy-medium body, low-moderate carbonation, rich, tad sticky, dry with sweet booze finish. Strong rye barrel in this one.

Bomber from Whole Foods PM. Pours deep coppery with off-white head that laces well. Nose is oaky, hoppy, woody, caramelly. Tastes oaky, with heavy whsiky notes, caramel, molasses, and some sweetness in the finish. More oaky spirits as it warms.
Mild honey nose. Ruby brown, thick orange head. Wood, orange, honey. Medium body, easy carbonation, warm.
Poured from bomber. Pours dark amber with an off white head. Fruity malt aroma with bourbon. Flavor is fruity malt start up front with brown sugar and boozy finish. Dry oak and bourbon in finish.

Small tan head, fair retention, skimpy lacing. Clear, amber body, purdddy. Mild nose of whisky and some grain. Body is middlin, carbo is low. Some dry caramel malts, whisky and grain. Dry finish, boozy?? bland. Uhhh. Bomber from statelineliquors.
Bottled. Poured maroon brown without much head. Strong whiskey notes. Toffee malt earth and wood. Not bad

Bottle from the brewery. Pours opaque nut brown with a fizzy beige head. Tastes like booze, earthy malt, nutty, and toffee. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like toffee malt, booze, earthy, and nutty.

Bottle from brewery. Pours clear brown. Aroma is cookie malt, plums, dates, caramel, vanilla, oak, and faint booze. Flavor is boozy throughout with some bready malts, sweet caramel and vanilla notes, some woodiness, piney bitterness, and a spicy alcohol finish. Medium/full body.

Cask at Maxs. This was labeled as 20yr storm - Sagamore BA. Seems thats actually the 21. Muddy, no clarity dark brown color. Soggy barrel aged English malts aroma. Lightly aged malts, light autolysis. Flavor is caramel tea malts and alcohol heft. A sticky mouthfeel mouthfeel and a alcoholic nutty aftertaste. The base beer is less interesting but the barrel is strong without being crazy horrible.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA
